website_summaries.verdict: The B&O Play Beoplay E4 earphones delivers above-average noise cancellation and solid audio performance in a somewhat dated design.
pros: Powerful audio performance with deep bass and bright highs
Solid noise cancellation, with transparency mode to monitor your surroundings
Can be used in passive mode
cons: Sound signature is very sculpted—not ideal for those seeking accuracy

customer_reviews.title: a nice fit in to the ear and still comfortable after ...
customer_reviews.text: Superb sound quality, a nice fit in to the ear and still comfortable after a few hours of use. Worth the money? My first set of earphones above the £50 mark, and only time will truly tell, but after a week with them I think they are a good investment. My only criticism is that the ANC box is very close to the jack plug and can end up pull on the jack. Whether this causes an issue over time, I'll have to wait and see. I am trying to take care and position my mobile so that the pulling is negated or minimized.
customer_reviews.author: Nobbby

customer_reviews.title: Comfy fit but can still hear voices
customer_reviews.text: I knew from reading other reviews that these headphones do not cancel out human voices, but still find it irritating to be sitting on a train and being able to hear conversations. These are muffled, but can still be annoying when they are seated closeby. Sound quality and noise reduction of engine noise and other ambient sounds is very good for in ear headphones, but can still be heard unless listening to music while noise cancellation is on. Battery life is more than enough for the twice weekly 3hrs continuous use I bought them for.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Crystalline clarity like a winter day
customer_reviews.text: As noted in many product reviews, these phones are not boombox bassy but you are trading heavy bass for unbelievable upper range clarity. The "you are there" immediacy of the synthesisers on Yazoo "Only You" or the guitar opening on Tom Petty "Free Fallin'" or the glockenspiel in Smokey Robinson "One Heartbeat" is just incredible with exceptional detail in songs you'd never noticed before. It's a matter of taste but definitely money well spent in my view.
customer_reviews.author: Fonaweb

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Don't cut out background sound much at all in the gym so no better than normal headphones though sound quality is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and the noise cancelling is fantastic.. Very easy to use controls too. Only downside is that it doesn’t have a clip to secure the wires to your clothing. Also it says the n the box that it’s designed for iPhone but it doesn’t come with an iPhone connection adapter which at this price should be included.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: These are the best yet
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few expensive in-ears, including RHA, Sony,Shure and 1More, but had to return the (thanks Amazon) as they didn't meet my listening requirements. Got these and think they are brilliant. They won't be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mr A.W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best cabled headphones I've had
customer_reviews.text: I wanted cabled (as opposed to Bluetooth) headphones for use on my laptop (there is a sound degradation issue when using Bluetooth with Citrix). This model was the only one on the market from Bang & Olufsen and the sound quality is what you would expect from B&O. I haven't needed to use the noise cancelling so can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar R

customer_reviews.title: Good for your ears
customer_reviews.text: Irritating when you forget to turn off noise cancellation when finished listening as battery will run out! Good for your ears as can have volume on much quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Cambronne

customer_reviews.title: Average noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancelling not great and there is a loss of sound quality. But without noise cancelling sound is very good. Not sure if they are worth over £100 though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 months and B&O refused to service
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. Within 3 months the noise cancelling feature started to malfunction and B&O has refused to service the product as 1. The label with the serial number fell off and 2. the Amazon invoice did not include the serial number.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: B&O fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic piece of kit, typical of B&O well engineered, sounds brilliant, would recommend to anyone who appreciates the fact that you only get what you pay for, In other words if you want top quality sound and build you're going to have to pay for it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heads up!
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price, just right for my ipod
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Gravener

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation actually sucks
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is fine, but the noise cancellation is not. I would say that there is only a 5% reduction in perception of non-music noise unless you are wearing the special memory foam ear thingies. So basically, the foam ear thingies are doing all of the work. Not worth the price or the annoying noise cancellation dongle. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Shambhavi Sarasvati

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, poor noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of these headphones is very good. However, I fly a lot and bought these mostly for the noise cancellation feature. Several other reviewers reported that the noise cancellation feature was good. However, that is not my experience. I tested these on dozens of flights and they continuously disappointed. I decided to keep them for the sound quality. There is a lot of improvement that needs to be made on the noise cancellation feature.
customer_reviews.author: mspeedwagon

customer_reviews.title: Great Noise Cancellation but mediocre sound
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality out of this rather pricey set is the same as any other earphones at much lower price range, so if sound quality is your thing, these B&Os aren't going to make an earth shattering difference. I returned mine.
customer_reviews.author: Siamak M.

customer_reviews.title: Ibought in for noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: The ear buds have a difficult fit for my ears, and the ability to cancel out noise (coming from neighbors next door) was limited
customer_reviews.author: dpmfoots

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: These are not really very user friendly. They do not fit in your ear all that well and fall out when exercising. I would not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: novalax

customer_reviews.title: gift for an audiophile - they were a hit!
customer_reviews.text: perfect on the treadmill, good sound quality, hoping they work well under hearing protection while operating the riding mower.
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed by the sound quality and noise cancellation. As good as my best over the ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: jacsatx

customer_reviews.title: Better than most
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation is not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling not as good as the Bose one
customer_reviews.text: Bose one wins. It is lighter and way outperforms this B&O piece in noise cancellation. I love the sound quality, though.
customer_reviews.author: chulhee lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for air travel
customer_reviews.text: I got these for air travel as a couple of times a month. Perfect for my needs. Doesn't cancel voices but gets rid of background noise so I don't need the volume blasting to hear whatever I am listening to or watching. Nice and compact for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Jaw dropping earphones
customer_reviews.text: The best ANC earphones in the market!!! It’s beautifully crafted Its ANC work perfectly The sound is outstanding It’s a jaw dropping earphone, I just loved it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Lara

customer_reviews.title: Can’t be happier
customer_reviews.text: Can’t be happier with the noise cancellation. I used to use Bose for a long time but i like this better. And design wise it’s way more beautiful
customer_reviews.author: shkz

customer_reviews.title: What you paid is what you get
customer_reviews.text: First purchase for Bang&Olufsen. As earplug does not easily build heat unlike sony wh-1000xm3. Light and easy to use. For quality and reliability tbc.
customer_reviews.author: Alphie Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Broke too soon
customer_reviews.text: Broke behind the plug, but still works. The noise cancellation is not nearly as good as Bose, but overall it worked for my needs for a wired headset.
customer_reviews.author: DV

customer_reviews.title: Not the right result for the money spent
customer_reviews.text: Quite disappointed in this product. Loss use of volume and on/off controls within 12 months and have to jiggle the jack in my devices to get sound working in both ears.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sopota

customer_reviews.title: Wired, good anc
customer_reviews.text: Was very good till the AirPods ANC came out a month later
customer_reviews.author: Johnson Koh

customer_reviews.title: Simply perfect
customer_reviews.text: Simply fantastic. Use to have the Bose equivalent but the sound of this one is simply outstanding. Clear and crisp. Noise cancelling works extremly well. Had no problems with the mic. Strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Gregori

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation feature really works!
customer_reviews.text: This product does an excellent job of noise cancelling. I purchased them because I could not hear properly with standard earbuds on a plane. These ear phones drown out engine noise, people talking, baby's crying they are amazing. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: debbied038

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Have had b & o products in the past and these are very good quality the noise cancelling is very good blocking out 97% of all sounds still able to here a small amount of outside sound
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Fairly uncomfortable and heavy. The battery pack is a bit annoying after a while. I usually buy Bose products but these were on sale so I thought I’d give them a try. I wouldn’t buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Mac

customer_reviews.title: love b and o
customer_reviews.text: If you've ever owned B&O you already know you can't beat their products for sheer quality. If not, then you're in for a lovely surprise. When they say noise cancelling, they mean it, so be careful not to use these when walking or cycling if you are anywhere near traffic - seriously, you won't hear that car coming. They'd be very useful for the gym or if your noisy neighbour is having band practice and you just want to cook your evening meal in peace as you listen to Enya. Love them, wouldn't be without them!
customer_reviews.author: TogekissWings

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: i do love these fabby earphones - I love the deep and full sound they provide across a variety of music types. Really useful for the gym and when out and about. The noise cancelling function is good, and very pleasing when listening to more refined music or spoken word tracks. I'm very impressed. What I don't love, is how uncomfortable they are at times, despite changing the earbuds. I often feel the small buds fall out, the larger ones pinch. For short periods, they are fine, but for longer use I'm not so keen.
customer_reviews.author: Bellyobibblybob

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I must have unusual ear canals as I find these things quite difficult to wear. They just keep slipping out (and I did try a range of the plugs) They are good earphones. The noise cancelling does work in most circumstances. Are they worth the price? Not sure on that
customer_reviews.author: Simon Tavener

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Left channel never worked properly in noise-cancelling mode (sound cut out with any significant change in air pressure), and B&O refused to fix or replace, even though it was under warranty. Build quality is generally good, though the jack itself is flimsy. Sound quality is pretty average, and is pretty massively coloured and non-transparent. Not great, considering the price. Not worth the money, particularly with the poor customer support from B&O.
customer_reviews.author: amc654

customer_reviews.title: Wired and pricey
customer_reviews.text: The E4 is designed to replace the H3. Materials are the same but the inline remote has been redesigned and the battery pack is now rectangular in shape. The simple switch operation moves from noise cancellation off to on and finally to transparency mode which allows ambient noise through the microphones. The comply memory foam ear pads aid noise reduction. Overall sound is above average and the noise cancelling is very effective. Most users I know prefer wireless earphones when they are out and about. If the E4 was wireless it would properly justify its price point.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Nimoy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is perfect with these earphones. They're as good as any set of earphones I've ever had in that respect. However upon opening the package I discovered all kinds of pieces of kit that I've never come across before. These headphones have a battery on the wires and it needs recharging every 20 hours. So there is a charging kit included. The benefit of the battery on the wire is that it reduces the chances of the wires becoming tangled. However the battery does also keep hitting me when I'm running, which is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Little Mo

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, comfortable headphones for savouring your sounds
customer_reviews.text: Good looking headphones that fit comfortably (I'm using the supplied Comply memory foam) and offer great sound. They do block out ambient noise, with the ANC feature all but eliminating it. The only niggles are the lack of EQ customisation and that turning to transparency mode, to hear what's going on around you, blocks out your music. There are times, running for example, when you might want to be able to hear the world and your music. So these are for sitting back, not working out.
customer_reviews.author: You caught me procrastinating again

customer_reviews.title: Great Earbuds but the controls on the cable do not work with Android
customer_reviews.text: Firstly..These are the best earbuds I have ever had I was so pleased with them, great noise cancellation on the plane especially with the foam tips, BUT, nowhere in the literature does it say the Volume controls don't work with Android. The sound quality from my Google Pixel is excellent but what a pain trying to change volume on the phone all the time. This should be printed on the box. I thought I had a faulty pair until I tried them through a friends iPhone which worked perfectly. B&O should make a separate version for Android. This was such a disappointment with an otherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ewm

customer_reviews.title: Very good noise canceling ear buds
customer_reviews.text: Very good noise canceling ear buds. This is my second set of noise canceling ear buds -- the other brand I tried got to be pretty flaky but I've had no problem at all with these. Great in the office and on the plane. People do need to be aware that "noise canceling" technology works best on steady background noises like plane engines or office ventilation type noises. It's not going to cancel out people talking nearby or banging noises. But I find it to be a huge upgrade over conventional ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: Pecos Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great Earphones by B&O PLAY
customer_reviews.text: While a tad pricey, these B&O PLAY earphones are exceptional. The sound quality is superb, bright and clear. The earphones are comfortable as well, including several earphone covers to adjust the size and fit. The design of the earphones are nice too, a dark charcoal and black. The only problem with the design is the built-in battery, which is a little bulky. Overall, I would definitely recommend these earphones to others looking for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Mentally in Paris

customer_reviews.title: Battery leaks and poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these at an airport. Battery leaked within 10 uses. Receipt was faded and illegible. Waste of money. Customer service was no help.
customer_reviews.author: IQof3

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't use for phone calls
customer_reviews.text: I loved the headphones, noise cancelling was actually pretty good as well. But after about 2-3 months of use they started acting up. If I was on a phone call people couldn't hear me from the mic, couldn't control the music from the headphones any more, and sometimes wouldn't play songs the right way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke in under a year, poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: I used these for travel for under a year and loved them. The Aux was plugged into the seat aux jack on a plane, and when I removed the cable from the jack the entire metal aux piece separated and got stuck inside the aux outlet, a clean break from the rest of the device. I contacted the company twice about this with photos and they would not cover it. Very poor customer service, I will no longer be a customer of B&O.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect sound with not quire perfect noise cancelation
customer_reviews.text: This review is for B&O PLAY by Bang & Olufsen Beoplay E4 Advanced Active Noise Cancelling Earphones. These are not by my standards inexpensive at 250.00 certainly the same price range of Bose products of a similar nature. The sound crisp and enjoyable but the noise canceling more of a noise blurring than cancelling. In spite of great sound I am not completely pleased with the less than optimal performance of the noise cancelation technology unless it is just my ears.
customer_reviews.author: tim can

customer_reviews.title: These produce a tinny sound to my ears
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the product. They produced a tinny sound to my ears when operating the noise cancellation. Not to my tastes. It is true that I do not like ear bud styles, but I can tolerate some. A few can be very well made and win me over. These were not comfortable, I did not like the sound and the box like contraption is unsightly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: but are not as comfortable as the Bose
customer_reviews.text: I was recently traveling in Denmark and purchased the E4 noise cancelling earphones on June 16, 2017 in the Bang & Olufsen store in Copenhagen. They work well, but are not as comfortable as the Bose. I did not notice any hiss. The big surprise, was that I was charged (in Danish Crowns) $340 USD. The store people told me that pricing for B&O was standard (like you would expect in an Apple store). The B&G official website shows the price as $249. The B&G response to my inquiry was that their individual stores set prices as they wish. So BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Dott B

customer_reviews.title: Just Plain Tinny.....
customer_reviews.text: two word sum up this product by B and O.........JUST AWFUL......i thought this would surpass my Bose wired noise canceling headphones!....well I can tell you this!.their is no comparison !........Bose is way better then these E4"s by B and O.......I find them to sound tinny, and the noise canceling is a joke!!.......I"m sorry but if you try these, and then try the Bose, I"m sure you will agree with me, that the Bose is Head and Shoulders better for treble mid range and bass, its just no contest.....
customer_reviews.author: Lone Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love B&O products. In my opinion, the best ever.
customer_reviews.author: Yuchen Wu

product_meta.title: Bang & Olufsen Beoplay E4 Advanced Active Noise Cancelling Earphones – Black - 1644526
product_meta.description:
Essential In-ear Headphones
Shut out the busy outside world and immerse yourself in pristine Bang & Olufsen Signature Sound with the Beoplay E4 advanced Active Noise Cancellation earphones. These lightweight in-ear headphones offer an unobtrusive way to enjoy an escape from hectic city life whenever you need it.

Immersive Sound
Equipped with next generation Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) technology, E4 headphones utilize two microphones to accurately and effectively reduce ambient sounds on both high and low frequencies. When you’re ready to let the outside world back in, one quick gesture turns on transparency mode so you can safely reconnect with ambient noises around you. The advanced ANC functionality lasts up to 20 hours per charge, and you can always listen at any time without ANC, even when the charge is exhausted.

Luxurious Design
Designed by Danish industrial designer Jakob Wagner, these simple but elegant headphones are crafted with an esthetically minimalist look and a truly comfortable fit. An essential accessory for either the daily commute or extended airplane travel, these lightweight and durable earphones are made with premium materials to ensure a premium listening experience.

Lightweight Comfort
The external housing on the earbuds consists of an ultra-light, stainless and scratch-resistant metal that is hairline brushed on the front to catch and reflect light and pearl blasted on the side for contrast. The inner housing is made of ergonomically-shaped polymer that feels good against your skin. Soft memory foam on the ear tips ensures a secure and comfortable fit and four sizes of silicone ear tips are also included. The inline remote with a durable aluminum and rubber finish lets you conveniently adjust volume, change tracks and answer calls on the go.

Flexible Control
Enjoy total control and flexibility in noisy environments whether you’re listening to a favorite song, discovering a new podcast or making an important call. An essential component in your busy life, lightweight E4 headphones won’t weigh you down as you move through your busy schedule.

Beoplay E4 comes with a choice of ear tips including Comply memory foam ear tips that enhance the noise cancelling capabilities with a secure, comfortable fit and noise isolating materials. And for those who prefer silicone tips, Beoplay E4 comes with four different sizes.
feature_bullets: ADVANCED ACTIVE NOISE CANCELLATION brings serenity to your busy world. The advanced hybrid ANC in these earbuds blocks out noisy environments while preserving Bang & Olufsen Signature Sound quality.
No Bluetooth. Frequency response - 20-16,000 Hz. Impedance - 16 Ohms

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars190 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
